message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.NI. 

The paper discusses safety and liveness violations in distributed systems, which are typically studied in the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also discusses Byzantine Fault Tolerance (BFT), which is a subfield of Cryptography and Security (cs.CR). The scenarios presented in the paper involve log slots and view changes, which are concepts commonly used in Distributed Systems (cs.DS). The paper also discusses the practical implementation of BFT, which falls under the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the impact of the violations on network performance, which is a topic studied in the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category.
